intro: Senecio laticipes, commonly known as the broadfoot senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, featuring upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in dense, spherical clusters, giving it a distinctive appearance. Senecio laticipes is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
